div.p: 86 000 hectares of rainforest for reintroductions - At the end of 2009 BOS Foundation was able to acquire concessions for the use of Kehje Sewen ("Orangutan Forest" in the Dayak language), initially for 60 years. A great success, since intact rainforests are urgently needed for the reintroductions of orangutans from the stations. The area is well suited for this because it meets all the necessary IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature) conditions.

p.b: Kehje Sewen is a suitable habitat for about 130 orangutans.

div.p: The acquisition of such concessionary use from the Indonesian government is only possible for companies. To this end BOS Foundation has founded a company (PT Restorasi Habitat Orangutan Indonesia, RHOI), which will hold the concession for BOS and which has submitted a detailed medium-term development plan for the are.
In 2012, the first orangutans from Samboja Lestari will be reintroduced to the area Kejeh Sewen.
